converse.line: Hey, mayor. What's going on?

random.line: Emere! Good to see you. And please, call me Rais.
Greetings, Emere. You decided yet about becoming my secretary?
What could I possibly do as a secretary? All you do is do paperwork.
That's not all I do. I also...go on vacation.
Wow, interesting. As I've said before, I am already busy with school and I already have a job.
This could be your job. It's very easy work, as you have said, it's mostly paperwork with a few speeches mixed in.
Government jobs don't pay well, I'll stick to being an art teacher.
Not much. Just being old over here.
That's very sad. Go outside and get some fresh air.
I would, but I'm too busy preparing for the next election. Speeches don't write themselves.
You don't need to worry about that. You're sure to get elected, the people love you.
One can not only hope, but must also act.

converse.line: Mayor, are you rich?

What kind of question is that? Very rude question. Since it's you, I'll tell you that I do have quite a bit of cash from my old entrepreneuring days. Did you know I started the gambling place in Fujita? Very profitable it was.
Wow. You've got quite the past.
Just don't mention that to the voters on election day. Now, why do you ask?

choice.line: I need a loan. It's important.
Do you mind telling me what for?

converse.line: You see, this lady, Nakamura is in a dilemma--
Hold on, did you say Nakamura? Oh boy... Haven't heard that name in a while.
You know her?
You could say that... Said she's in trouble?

Yeah, her husband was murdered when he went to get a locket fixed. She's really sad now and I think giving here the locket will make her happier. I found the locket at a pawnshop, so I was wondering if you could loan me something expensive to trade. I can work as your secretary to pay you back if need be. How about it?
That's a hard offer to refuse. But I do have to refuse it--
But why? I can pay you--
You didn't let me finish. I'll give you something for free.
Oh. But, it wouldn't feel right not paying you back.

It's fine, Emere. You see, back when I was a youngster like you, I went to the same school as Nakamura. I was a shy one, but once I joined the music club, I quickly made friends. Two of those friends were Nakamura and her future husband, Wallace. We did everything together, and my friendship quickly turned into love. However, shy as I was, I could never confess. Wallace beat me to it, and the two became lovers. I felt left out, and our meetings slowly faded away. I went to college to study business and never saw her again.
How's that for a sad story? But you see, my love never faded. I never fell in love with anybody else, although I had plenty of opportunity to do so. That's why I still want to make her happy.
Take this watch of mine to give to the pawnbroker.
I am overwhelmed by your kind heart. You are the nicest old man I've met.
Nice for an old man? That's quite the compliment.
Just take the watch and make Nakamura happy.
I'll be sure to mention you. Thank you!
You got the locket yet? No? What are you waiting for?
You got the locket yet? Yes? What are you waiting for? Give it to her.
She says she'll visit you.
Great!

choice.line: Oh, just fine. I've got a speech tomorrow to give to the town. Mind proofreading it for me?
You're a great help, Emere. Thank you.
Why, yes! She stopped by this morning for a cup of tea. We talked for nearly three hours, catching up on the years we lost together. We're even going out to dinner this next weekend.
That's great! So...are you two dating?
Well, erm, I...well I guess you could say that.
